intro: Tephrosia senna, commonly known as African senna, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Tephrosia senna is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which makes it valuable in agricultural systems. Its seeds are sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of dye.
